title.rendered: Incentive Travel London: Sustainable tours, travel and stays

acf.author: Cameron Williamson
acf.preview_text: Host your incentive group travel in London with our Corporate incentive travel planners. Motivate your employees with life changing experiences.

content.title: Introduction
content.content:
Meta: Host your incentive group travel in London with our Corporate incentive travel planners. Motivate your employees with life changing experiences.

London, with its rich history and vibrant culture, offers a world class destination for a bucket-list worthy incentive trip or business event.

Iconic landmarks on every corner – Buckingham Palace, Tower Bridge, Tate modern to name a few, and a thriving food and fashion scene, London truly has it all when it comes to topping the list of best incentive travel destinations

Add to this, the city leads the charge on sustainable travel and certification with its green tourism for London scheme – awarding business that are actively engaged in reducing the negative environmental and social impacts of their tourism operations.

So choose London for your incentive tour destination and reward your employees with unforgettable experiences while aligning your brand with a city dedicated to creating a better future.

content.title: Day 1
content.content:
Day 1

Morning: Arrive in London and check into an eco-friendly hotel such as The Zetter Hotel in Clerkenwell or The Savoy in Covent Garden – both sustainable hotels that prioritise energy efficiency, waste reduction, responsible sourcing and guest luxury and comfort.

Mid-Morning: Kickstart your London adventures with a popular eco tour – a guided walking tour of the city’s iconic landmarks, led by a knowledgeable local guide. Explore the historic streets of Westminster, marvel at the grandeur of Buckingham Palace, and take in the architectural wonders of the Tower Bridge and the Houses of Parliament.

Afternoon: Explore London’s rich cultural scene with a private group tour of the Tate Modern, one of the world’s leading contemporary art museums. Experience thought-provoking exhibits and engage in fascinating talks about art, sustainability, and social impact.

Evening: Mark your first evening in London with a memorable dining experience at The Ethicurean, a sustainable restaurant that champions seasonal and locally sourced ingredients. Delight in a farm-to-table feast, where every dish tells a story of ethical food practices and culinary craftsmanship.

content.title: Day 2
content.content:
Day 2

Morning: Head to the water and set sail on a Thames River cruise and view the city’s iconic landmarks from a different perspective. Sail past the Tower of London, Shakespeare’s Globe Theatre, and the majestic St. Paul’s Cathedral while learning about the river’s ecological importance and efforts to protect its ecosystem.

Afternoon: Enjoy a fascinating street art tour in the vibrant neighborhoods of Shoreditch and Camden. Explore the ever-evolving graffiti and mural art scene, led by passionate local guides who share the stories, meanings and community impact behind the artwork. This is a great way to engage with the dynamic street culture of London and witness how art can transform public spaces into thought-provoking urban galleries.

Early Evening: Next head to nearby Camden Town, a vibrant neighborhood known for its eclectic markets and street art. Explore the bustling stalls of Camden Market, sample international cuisine from local food vendors, host a team challenge amongst the market stalls, and soak up the vibrant atmosphere of this creative hub.

Late Evening: Conclude the day with an exclusive backstage tour and live performance at Shakespeare’s Globe Theatre, a reconstruction of the original Elizabethan playhouse. Experience the magic of Shakespearean theater and celebrate the enduring legacy of the world’s greatest playwright.

content.title: Day 3
content.content:
Day 3

Morning: Offer your team one of three eco-friendly activities – a private scenic cycling tour through the iconic landmarks of London exploring the city’s vibrant neighborhoods, picturesque parks, and historic sites. Or a thrilling adventure at Lee Valley White Water Centre, where white water rafting or kayaking will push your limits and build camaraderie. Or discover the world of sustainable fashion with a visit to the Fashion for Good Museum. Explore innovative and eco-friendly approaches to fashion design, production, and consumption, and learn about the importance of ethical fashion choices.

Afternoon: Next up, get out into nature with an afternoon at Kew Gardens, a UNESCO World Heritage Site and a haven of biodiversity. Take in the remarkable landscapes, glasshouses, and diverse plant collections while gaining insights into conservation efforts and sustainable gardening practices. Enjoy an English picnic in the gardens with the backdrop of peaceful woodlands and dazzling fragrant rose bushes.

Early Evening: Treat your team to a farewell dinner at Silo, the world’s first zero-waste restaurant, renowned for circular, sustainable gastronomy (it doesn’t even have a bin!). Delight in a menu crafted from locally sourced, organic ingredients and observe true commitment to minimal waste and ecological responsibility in action.

Late Evening: Conclude your London incentive group travel experience with a rooftop celebration at the Sky Garden, an urban oasis offering panoramic views of the city’s skyline. Raise a glass to the memories made, the connections forged, and the sustainable learnings that have shaped this extraordinary journey together.

As your incentive travel experience comes to a close, take with you the inspiration, knowledge, and shared experiences that will empower your team to embrace community, sustainability and responsible practices in all aspects of life.

footer.text: On Purpose events is a sustainable event management company. We help businesses, associations and government on a path toward carbon neutral meetings and events with lasting positive impact. Together we can create a better future, one event at a time.

block_1.title: On Purpose Events;Creating positive lasting impact
block_1.text: We’re a sustainable event management company with a purpose – to help you plan and deliver low carbon or carbon neutral events with lasting positive impact, and without compromise.

block_3.title: We’re sustainable  event planners
block_3.text:
As a profit-for-purpose event agency, we help organisations, associations and government plan stand-out live, virtual and hybrid events that don’t cost the Earth.

Our smart sustainable event planning solutions combine world-class strategy, creative and tech to exceed expectations, meet ESG commitments and add real brand value.

block_4.title: Helping you create positive lasting impact
block_4.text:
Our purpose-driven event organisers bring together innovative thinking with a unique sustainable event planning framework and strategic partnerships to design and deliver smarter, high-impact, carbon neutral meetings, events and group travel.

In short, we help you take the simple steps that create a positive lasting impact on your attendees, your community, your brand and our planet.

block_5.title: Let’s connect and create  your next event

block_6.title: How it works
block_6.text: First, we gain an understanding of what event success looks like to you. Then we create a tailored event strategy that includes a sustainable event, carbon reduction and offset plan to make it easier for you to take meaningful climate action. Once you’re happy with the program, our event production specialists get to work on bringing your event to life.

list.title: Create
list.text: Share your event vision and sustainability goals with us. Our event organisers will bring their creative smarts to bring it all to life with a tailored event program.

list.title: Plan
list.text: We’ll create a sustainable event plan to reduce carbon emissions and calculate your footprint. You can focus on one portion of your event – like travel, waste, food, merch – or the whole event.

list.title: Deliver
list.text: Sit back while we deliver every aspect of your event, from sustainable supplier and venue sourcing to coordinating speakers and delegates to minimising waste and carbon emissions.

list.title: Offset
list.text: Choose to make all or part of your event carbon neutral by purchasing verified carbon offsets for those often-unavoidable event emissions, like travel.

list.title: Reflect
list.text: We’ll take time to evaluate what went well, report on your wins, and give you actionable insights to improve the impact of future events.

block_9.title: Creating greener events, together
block_9.text: We’ll help you on your path to more sustainable events that meet your event objectives, your ESG goals and your budget.

block_10.title: Your Questions Answered
block_10.text: Everything you need to know about sustainable events. Can’t find the answer you’re looking for – please chat to our team.

list.title: What types of events do you plan?
list.text:
Since 2009, our corporate event planners have delivered stand-out virtual, hybrid and in-person event experiences that bring industry people together for business and pleasure and a good mix of both.

Be it banking and insurance executives, hospitality and tourism managers, manufacturing and construction workers, education providers and government department teams, we’ve built close relationships and a deep understanding of each industry’s unique challenges.

Our people know what it takes to produce consistently high calibre industry events that enlighten and delight your people. We’re like an extension of your team, bringing you flexible, scalable corporate event management for your conference, trade show, awards night, offsite and celebration needs.

Let’s connect and create your next event

list.title: How do your fees work?
list.text:
We understand the importance of achieving agreed travel and event budgets and providing you with real value every step of the way.

Our approach to event fees is designed to be clear and honest, supported by prompt communications and timely reporting.

We’re flexible in our fee structure. You can work with us on a time and expense basis or a flat project rate. But as most clients prefer to know how much a sustainable event program will cost, inclusive of all fees, we generally work on a flat project rate that’s agreed upfront to avoid any unexpected surprises.

Either way, we also bring you access to our mighty buying power when sourcing and negotiating across our sustainable event venue and supplier network, and we pass these savings on to benefit our clients’ bottom line.

And you’ll have added peace of mind in knowing we manage the risk associated with deposit schedules, vendor payments and service agreements. 

Get an obligation-free quote

list.title: Will a low emissions or carbon neutral event cost more?
list.text:
Sustainable events don’t cost the earth. In fact, well executed sustainable event management planning can reduce costs. How? By minimising waste disposal, energy, transport and logistics expenses, and by partnering with sustainable vendors offering comparable or lower fees. 

Carbon neutral events also create unique offset opportunities for sponsors and give your event and your brand real competitive advantage in the marketplace.Yes, there may be some upfront costs associated with implementing sustainable event production, but overall cost savings and the positive impact on your brand, community and the environment often far outweigh that initial investment.

Get an obligation-free quote and see where you can save

list.title: Why is tackling my event’s carbon footprint important?
list.text:
When you consider the average conference attendee produces 1.89 kg of landfill-bound waste per day, and 2.6 kg of carbon emissions per day*, it’s easy to see how climate impact can add up. It’s time for us all to do more to reduce the carbon footprint of events. And it’s not just your ESG commitments calling for more responsible action. More customers, employers and stakeholders want to see companies taking meaningful action. Choosing to position your business on the right side of history with sustainable event management is good for your brand as well as the planet.

Let us help you take action with your next event

list.title: How do you reduce my event’s carbon impact?
list.text:
Our event organisers take your brief and the time to understand your sustainability goals before carefully tailoring a plan to reduce your event’s carbon footprint. 

If you’re just starting your climate journey, you might choose to begin at Stage 1 – Change Starter – which gives you the option to measure, reduce and offset emissions for one specific portion of your event, such as attendee travel or catering. 

If you’re ready to elevate your whole event to Sustainable status, we can take it to Stage 2 – Change Maker. Our event planners will implement ways to reduce your event’s carbon footprint across energy and waste management, catering, transport, procurement, marketing and communications. We’ll take care of sustainable venue sourcing too. Stage 3 steps it right up to Game Changer – Carbon Neutral Event – the ultimate green badge of honour for your brand. It ticks all of the above boxes AND offsets all unavoidable emissions to achieve carbon neutral events.

And we calculate and report on the sum of your event’s climate impact with sustain.life – our sustainability software partner that powers our event carbon measurement, ESG reporting and verified offsets in line with global standards.

Tell us your brief and we’ll tailor a solution to fit

list.title: How do you select venues and vendors?
list.text:
Having the right vendors on board can make or break your event. Over the years, we’ve built lasting relationships with exceptional event vendors that have accredited sustainability credentials and our complete trust.

Our little green book contains a network of sustainable event suppliers from venues, catering, audio-visual, entertainment, styling, speakers, merch and more. 

We preference suppliers that have sustainability certification or membership that demonstrates their commitment to environmental and social responsibility. And we communicate our sustainability objectives from the start to find collective solutions that align with our event goals and budget.

Once we’ve secured your vendor, we take care of all the headaches of vendor management too, including contract negotiation, performance metrics, reporting, insurance, and payments, leaving nothing to chance. 

Honestly, what have you got to lose? Get in touch

list.title: How do you calculate and report on our event carbon footprint?
list.text:
We’ve partnered with world-class accredited sustainability management software provider sustain.life to power our event carbon measurement, ESG reporting and offsets.

Using GHG protocol calculation methods, we can accurately measure, manage and report on the full climate impact of accommodation, travel, waste, energy, food, merch, giveaways and more, and balance your event’s emissions with verified carbon offsets.

In a world awash with greenwashing, that level of transparency and accountability will give your brand the competitive advantage in winning customers’ hearts and stakeholders’ minds.

Let’s start building your sustainable event plan

content.rendered: At On Purpose Events, we plan incentive travel programs that help you reach your goals, empower your team, and make a positive environmental and social impact

event_info.title: Incentive travel with positive lasting impact
event_info.text:
You bring your vision, we’ll bring the creative, technical, and logistical wizardry, plus access to our worldwide network and deep local knowledge to nail your incentive and group travel goals.

From executive retreats, leadership summits and staff incentive travel to group travel events for academics, sports or entertainment, we have the expertise and know-how to deliver the experience of a lifetime.

cases.post_content:
The Event

Inform Group, a regular client of ours, were looking to host their third annual client appreciation event. It's crucial that the event reflects the brand's personality, and that the atmosphere creates a buzz to drive brand affinity and establish deeper client relationships. The chosen event venue was Beta Bar in Sydney, creating a unique juxtaposition between old and new to embody the “Tron Futurism” inspired theme.

The Result

Inform’s narrative of innovation and creativity in media was brought to life through LED robot dance shows, daft punk DJ sets and neon cocktail-making stations with custom menus.
Captivating entertainment and playful interactive stations created excitement around the brand and provided Inform with the opportunity to spend time with important clients and representatives in an imaginative yet informal setting. The evening concluded with a wow-factor fully choreographed LED dance show showcasing the client's brand "Inform" digitally onto the robots shields.

The Event

AQ, the peak youth travel industry body for Queensland sought an experienced events company to deliver a showstopping conference and gala for the AUS & NZ travel industry.
The industry-led conference and gala provided a relaxed forum for community members to gain insight into the latest industry trends, and share knowledge and ideas through dynamic panel sessions and keynotes. The evening gala awards dinner rewarded youth tourism operators for their dedication and hard work, and recognised top achievers across the industry.

The Result

On Purpose facilitated full scale event management of the annual Youth Tourism Conference and Adventure Tourism Awards.
Attendees came together in the Gold Coast to learn, solve and connect on the diverse challenges facing the Australia and New Zealand tourism industry during a curated 1-day conference and gala program. The results were astounding, with 230+ businesses nominated and 14,000 votes cast for the prestigious awards. Winners were recognised across 34 categories during the awards night attended by 300+ industry members.

list.title: What is your approach to tailoring an incentive trip for our company?
list.text:
Every single client in the global event management world is unique. So before we dive into destination selection, trip planning and logistics, we get to know you and your unique incentive group travel purpose and goals.

We build an understanding of your group dynamic, the individual personalities, interests and preferences of your team. Then we get to work on creating a well-balanced, cohesive, and memorable incentive trip itinerary that fits your people, brand values and budget.

Our approach to destination management is grounded in sustainability, and we strive to minimise the environmental impact of our trips while maximising the positive impact on local communities.

Want to know more about our sustainable approach to incentive group travel planning and how we reduce and offset our impact?

Learn more about our sustainable model

block_14.title: Incentive travel planning
block_14.text:
Through meaningful storytelling and authentic local experiences – all carefully tailored to your brand and goals – we inspire genuine awe and build deeper connections between your people, your brand and your chosen destination.

But we’re not just passionate about travel. We’re committed to working with local communities and organisations to create a positive impact through sustainable, social and cultural incentive travel that’s better for people and planet.

block_14.title: Group travel management

Team up with our group travel management experts and create a bespoke travel experience that goes beyond the ordinary.

As a local group travel company with global reach, we act as an extension of your team, handling every detail with world-class tech, global networks and VIP travel support every step of the way.

From the big ticket items like group flights, accommodation, meals, ground transfers, and tours, to the nitty gritty like visas and insurance, we take care of everything. Let’s kickstart your travel plans today.

cases.post_content:
The Event

In celebration of top performers across their Melbourne retail banking divisions, ANZ chose OP Events to reinvigorate their two gala awards evenings with a fresh, forward-looking event concept. ANZ's prestigious annual award ceremonies mean a lot to the business and its people, both in recognising those who have exceeded all expectations while inspiring others to aim for the same lofty heights of achievement. After deep client consultation, it was clear that we needed an innovative event concept that embodied the challenges the industry and its people had faced while illuminating the path forward.

The Result

On Purpose Events brought to life ANZ "Illuminate"; an event theme designed to highlight star performers across the business alongside ANZ’s commitment to innovation, forward-thinking, pushing boundaries and letting go of traditions that no longer serve their community.
Intelligent lighting effects, glow furniture and deep contrasts lifted the iconic blue tone of ANZ, transforming both event spaces in Melbourne's Docklands and Crown Promenade Resorts. Guests were met by cybertron waitresses on arrival, were entertained by robotic artist performances and took home branded mirror booth photos as a keepsake of a very special evening full of recognition and celebration.

block_14.title: Venue sourcing
block_14.text:
Uncovering the best-kept secrets in town, from hidden gems to iconic landmarks, our team has a nose for discovering the hottest, newest and eco-friendly event venues around. Whether it’s a corporate meeting, conference, exhibition or gala dinner, we understand that the right venue is the cornerstone of a successful event. So why settle for the ordinary when we can help you achieve the extraordinary?

Finding it yourself makes a lot of work and headaches searching online directories or handling multiple venue proposals, RFPs, contracts and payments. With our expertise, lightning-fast venue finding service and jedi negotiation skills we’ll locate the perfect space to make your event truly unforgettable.

block_14.title: Group accommodation
block_14.text:
Our event and conference venue finders will book the perfect venue and accommodation combination to create a seamless experience for your group event. Budget, mid-level or luxury, city or regional, we’ll search our extensive global directory of hotel, meeting and event venue spaces that adopt sustainable practices.

But that’s not all. We know that managing group accommodation and rooming allocations can be a headache, which is why we’ve developed smart delegate registration solutions that take care of all the complexities. No more juggling spreadsheets and emails – we’ve got you covered from start to finish, so you can sit back, relax, and enjoy a stress-free event.

event_info.title: Event management  done differently
event_info.text:
Our On Purpose event experts create sustainable events that nail your objectives, connect your community, inspire positive change and tread lightly on the planet. From kickstart to wrap-up, it’s a feel-good experience you’ll never forget.

We tailor and flex to fit your needs. Our event management services can act as a bolt-on to your existing team or take care of the entire event  – planning, managing and delivering your meetings, incentives, conferences and more, down to the last detail.

cases.post_content:
The Event

In celebration of top performers across their Melbourne retail banking divisions, ANZ chose OP Events to reinvigorate their two gala awards evenings with a fresh, forward-looking event concept. ANZ's prestigious annual award ceremonies mean a lot to the business and its people, both in recognising those who have exceeded all expectations while inspiring others to aim for the same lofty heights of achievement. After deep client consultation, it was clear that we needed an innovative event concept that embodied the challenges the industry and its people had faced while illuminating the path forward.

The Result

On Purpose Events brought to life ANZ "Illuminate"; an event theme designed to highlight star performers across the business alongside ANZ’s commitment to innovation, forward-thinking, pushing boundaries and letting go of traditions that no longer serve their community.
Intelligent lighting effects, glow furniture and deep contrasts lifted the iconic blue tone of ANZ, transforming both event spaces in Melbourne's Docklands and Crown Promenade Resorts. Guests were met by cybertron waitresses on arrival, were entertained by robotic artist performances and took home branded mirror booth photos as a keepsake of a very special evening full of recognition and celebration.

The Event

OP events produced the inaugural Benevolent Society Carer Gateway Carnivale Day at Pyrmont Park in Sydney to celebrate Australia's 2.7 million unpaid carers. We conceptualised a fun, relaxing and family-friendly carnival themed event to be welcoming and inclusive to carers and their families, and a true celebration of carers' contributions. Hosting a large-scale event such as this in a public parkland called for detailed event management plans, rigorous event risk, health and safety assessment, and thorough stakeholder engagement, all of which was expertly steered by our OP event specialists.

The Result

On Purpose facilitated seamless, full scale event planning and management of the Benevolent Society Carer Gateway Carnival Day. Carers and their families came together in Sydney to enjoy fun live entertainment and a range of curated wellness activities from art therapy and group mindfulness exercises to arts and crafts, dress-ups and games for the kids to enjoy. A range of food trucks were available for attendees to pick up a bite to eat, and picnic zones were dotted throughout the event site for families to relax and enjoy the carnival atmosphere. Information stalls were setup for the Carer gateway team and partners to answer questions and offer support to those in a caring role or new to caregiving. Despite a rainy day in Sydney we welcomed 1500+ carers and their families to the event and were deeply humbled to play our part in celebrating those that dedicate their lives to caring for our loved ones. We are thrilled to be working with Benevolent on event planning for the 2024 carer’s festival.

block_14.title: Event strategy  and creative
block_14.text: Before we talk creative, we talk about you. We get to know your people, values, goals and vision for your event. Then we let our creativity off the leash, get stuck into tailoring the strategy and carefully planning every fine detail, including event emissions reduction and carbon offsets, all in close collaboration with you. And if it means pushing some boundaries to get the results you really want, we’ll push them as far as it takes.

block_14.title: Event production
block_14.text:
We handle all the event production and logistics details to deliver your event on time, on brand and with a lasting positive sustainable impact that’ll turn your attendees into raving fans. That includes leveraging the right event technology for your live, hybrid or virtual event, delivering killer cut-through content, and taking care of everything right down to packing the last conference bag.

Find out more about our approach to sustainable event management.

block_14.title: Virtual and hybrid events
block_14.text:
Fully virtual and hybrid event formats are offering the most innovative and sustainable ways for companies to meet event goals, whether that’s delivering education, recognising achievement, creating networking opportunities, providing value to attendees and sponsors, or retaining revenue from a cancelled physical event. But planning and delivering one, with all the right components, can be a daunting proposition.

Our experts in virtual and hybrid event management planning can help you put the best tech solutions and your best resources to keep the energy, excitement and attendee engagement levels high and the rave reviews coming in.

The Event

In celebration of top performers across their Melbourne retail banking divisions, ANZ chose OP Events to reinvigorate their two gala awards evenings with a fresh, forward-looking event concept. Guests were met by cybertron waitresses on arrival, were entertained by robotic artist performances and took home branded mirror booth photos as a keepsake of a very special evening full of recognition and celebration.

The Event

Australia's largest asset finance broker group chose OP Events for full-service event management of their annual 2.5-day conference and trade show program for 250+ attendees. The brief was to nurture a sense of community amongst members, celebrate top performers, and provide brokers, financiers and sponsors with an inspiring forum to learn, grow and connect. One of the key challenges was to create a unified message and sense of cohesion across multiple business units, and provide a refreshing and reinvigorating experience for delegates.

The Result

OP events produced a multi-staged conference, trade show, gala awards and partner excursion program hosted in multiple venue spaces located across the spectacular resort destination of Hamilton Island. Attendees were hosted across 2 hotels based on client category and exec level. Delegates came together in conference to collaborate, share challenges and opportunities, and enjoy the very best of Whitsunday Island hospitality. The event concluded with the plenary space transformed into a showstopping gala awards evening that quite literally took attendees' breath away.

content.rendered: We bring the secret sauce to unleash the power of your meetings, conferences and events.

event_info.title: Connect, engage and empower your people
event_info.text:
Empower your people, build affinity to your brand and create lasting positive impact with our On Purpose event specialists on your team. From mini meetings and internal corporate events to industry trade shows and epic national roadshows, our corporate event managers and conference planners will flex to fit your needs and budget, handle every detail and exceed all expectations.

And with our sustainable conferences and meetings management approach we create a real sense of being part of something bigger, something with meaningful environmental and social impact.

cases.post_content:
The Event

In celebration of top performers across their Melbourne retail banking divisions, ANZ chose OP Events to reinvigorate their two gala awards evenings with a fresh, forward-looking event concept. ANZ's prestigious annual award ceremonies mean a lot to the business and its people, both in recognising those who have exceeded all expectations while inspiring others to aim for the same lofty heights of achievement. After deep client consultation, it was clear that we needed an innovative event concept that embodied the challenges the industry and its people had faced while illuminating the path forward.

The Result

On Purpose Events brought to life ANZ "Illuminate"; an event theme designed to highlight star performers across the business alongside ANZ’s commitment to innovation, forward-thinking, pushing boundaries and letting go of traditions that no longer serve their community.
Intelligent lighting effects, glow furniture and deep contrasts lifted the iconic blue tone of ANZ, transforming both event spaces in Melbourne's Docklands and Crown Promenade Resorts. Guests were met by cybertron waitresses on arrival, were entertained by robotic artist performances and took home branded mirror booth photos as a keepsake of a very special evening full of recognition and celebration.

The Event

Australia's largest asset finance broker group chose OP Events for full-service event management of their annual 2.5-day conference and trade show program for 250+ attendees. The brief was to nurture a sense of community amongst members, celebrate top performers, and provide brokers, financiers and sponsors with an inspiring forum to learn, grow and connect. One of the key challenges was to create a unified message and sense of cohesion across multiple business units, and provide a refreshing and reinvigorating experience for delegates.

The Result

OP events produced a multi-staged conference, trade show, gala awards and partner excursion program hosted in multiple venue spaces located across the spectacular resort destination of Hamilton Island. Attendees were hosted across 2 hotels based on client category and exec level. Delegates came together in conference to collaborate, share challenges and opportunities, and enjoy the very best of Whitsunday Island hospitality. The event concluded with the plenary space transformed into a showstopping gala awards evening that quite literally took attendees' breath away.

block_3.title: Join 100's of companies committed to greener events

block_4.title: Professional conference organisers
block_4.text:
Our conference planners and organisers know what it takes to streamline all the moving parts that deliver crowd-winning conference programs.

We can work with you on a specific element of your conference management, such as venue sourcing and delegate registration. Or we can manage the complete end-to-end process.

We’ll even help you clarify your event budget and establish your key event goals and objectives if you’re not quite clear on that yet. We’ll be your guide, bringing peace of mind every step of the way.

list.title: Strategic meetings management
list.text:
If you’re just getting started on your strategic meetings management journey, we can guide and support you to roll out your program from local to global – we’ll work within your meeting policy to streamline tasks and track effectiveness.

If you’re working with siloed systems and scattered data, we can help you centralise your meetings and events management to mitigate risks, minimise stress and maximise visibility of ROI.

Our meeting and event planners will take care of everyday tasks too, such as sourcing venues, managing suppliers and negotiating contracts. Whatever it takes, we’re here to help you deliver your meetings management goals and maximise value at every level.

list.title: Delegate management
list.text:
Our best-in-class delegate management services deliver the personalised and professional experience your delegates look for, so they feel well supported throughout their event experience.

But moreover, we bring an environmentally and socially responsible approach to delegate management. From paper-less digital communications, e-registration and check-ins to electric vehicle transfer – we’ll impress your delegates at every touchpoint.

Pre-event

Targeted promotional campaigns, beautiful on-brand event websites and seamless registration flows that turn visitors into registrants.

On-event

VIP speaker and sponsor support. Smooth transfers. Seamless event check-in solutions. And event meetings apps that put real-time event information and updates at your delegates’ fingertips.

Post-event

Smarter, faster delegate feedback follow-up. Gain key insights and build a complete profile of your attendees, your event success, and ROI to inform your next event.

block_12.text: Let’s plan your next corporate event for maximum positive impact.

block_14.title: Event strategy  and creative
block_14.text: Before we talk creative, we talk about you. We get to know your people, values, goals and vision for your event. Then we let our creativity off the leash, get stuck into tailoring the strategy and carefully planning every fine detail, including event emissions reduction and carbon offsets, all in close collaboration with you. And if it means pushing some boundaries to get the results you really want, we’ll push them as far as it takes.

block_14.title: Event production
block_14.text:
We handle all the event production and logistics details to deliver your event on time, on brand and with a lasting positive sustainable impact that’ll turn your attendees into raving fans. That includes leveraging the right event technology for your live, hybrid or virtual event, delivering killer cut-through content, and taking care of everything right down to packing the last conference bag.

Find out more about our approach to sustainable event management.

block_14.title: Virtual and hybrid events
block_14.text:
Fully virtual and hybrid event formats are offering the most innovative and sustainable ways for companies to meet event goals, whether that’s delivering education, recognising achievement, creating networking opportunities, providing value to attendees and sponsors, or retaining revenue from a cancelled physical event. But planning and delivering one, with all the right components, can be a daunting proposition.

Our experts in virtual and hybrid event management planning can help you put the best tech solutions and your best resources to keep the energy, excitement and attendee engagement levels high and the rave reviews coming in.

content.title: Introduction
content.content:
Meta: Discover Singapore as a sustainable destination for eco-friendly meetings and events.

Singapore has made significant strides towards sustainability, with ambitious targets and initiatives in place to further improve the city’s sustainability credentials. As a client planning an incentive trip, you can be assured that your visit to Singapore can be curated to have minimal impact on the environment, while still enjoying all the city has to offer.

content.title: Fast facts
content.content:
Fast facts

  • The Singapore Green Plan 2030, or the Green Plan, is a whole-of-nation movement to advance Singapore’s national agenda on sustainable development. The green plan sets out concrete targets over the next 10 years, strengthening Singapore’s commitments under the UN’s 2030 Sustainable Development Agenda and Paris Agreement, and positioning Singapore to achieve long-term net zero emissions by 2050.
  • Sustainable Tourism: Singapore is committed to promoting sustainable tourism, with a focus on preserving the city’s natural and cultural heritage. In 2017, the Singapore Tourism Board launched the Green Step Programme, which encourages hotels and tourism businesses to adopt environmentally sustainable practices. As of 2021, over 200 businesses have joined the programme.
  • Sustainable Meetings and Events: Singapore has a range of green venues for meetings, incentives, conferences and events. One of the most acclaimed sustainable venues is the Sands Expo and Convention Centre. Held up as one of Asia’s leading sustainable venues, every event at the Sands is sustainable from the get-go with carbon neutral status and triple platinum certification. Sustainable culinary options, circular decor and food waste donations are standard sustainable meeting practice here.
  • Green Buildings: Singapore has one of the highest concentrations of green buildings in the world. As of 2020, over 80% of the city’s buildings are certified as environmentally sustainable, with more than 3,000 buildings certified under the Building and Construction Authority’s (BCA) Green Mark scheme. The city is also home to iconic green buildings such as Gardens by the Bay and the Marina Bay Sands.
  • Waste Management: Singapore has a robust waste management system, with a recycling rate of around 60%. The city also uses waste-to-energy incineration and landfill for waste disposal. However, Singapore is actively working towards reducing waste and increasing recycling rates. The government has set a target to increase the recycling rate to 70% by 2030 and to become a zero-waste nation by 2050.

acf.author: Cameron Williamson
acf.preview_text: Discover Melbourne as a sustainable destination for eco-friendly meetings and events.

content.title: Introduction
content.content:
Meta: Discover Melbourne as a sustainable destination for eco-friendly meetings and events.

Melbourne is a city that puts sustainability and environmental impact centre-stage. Renowned for its vibrant business events and incentive programs, Melbourne offers a wide range of sustainable event, venue and activity options tailored to the needs of eco-conscious businesses and travellers.

content.title: Fast facts
content.content:
Fast facts

  • Melbourne is recognised as a global sustainability leader, ranking number one position as a sustainable city in the Asia-Pacific region for business events in the Global Destination Sustainability Index 2021, and number 11 in the world overall.
  • The City of Melbourne has set ambitious targets through its Emissions Reduction Plan to achieve a 50% reduction in carbon emissions by 2030. And the state of Victoria, where Melbourne is the capital city, has set a target to achieve net-zero emissions by 2050.
  • To achieve its long-term goal, the City of Melbourne has implemented a range of initiatives. Notably, it aims to source 50% of its energy from renewable sources by 2030, and have 80% of all trips being undertaken by sustainable modes of transport by the same year.
  • Sustainable Meetings and Events: Melbourne has a range of sustainable venues for meetings, incentives, conferences and events. One of the most acclaimed sustainable venues is the Melbourne Convention and Exhibition Centre – the first convention centre in the world to be awarded a 6* rating. The MCEC is also Earthcheck gold certified 2022, has been awarded the Premier’s Sustainability Award, and demonstrates a true commitment to operating as a sustainable events destination.
  • When it comes to sustainable travel and experiences, Melbourne boasts an impressive number of parks and green spaces, with over 480 hectares of parkland within the city, including the famous Royal Botanic Gardens, which spans 38 hectares and houses more than 8,500 plant species. The city also has over 135 kilometers of on-road bicycle lanes and 120 kilometers of off-road shared paths, making it easier for cyclists to navigate through the city.
  • Melbourne is also known for hosting various sustainable events and festivals. The annual Melbourne Sustainable Living Festival for example promotes eco-friendly practices and showcases sustainable solutions. Additionally, the city has implemented sustainable event guidelines which support event organisers to reduce waste and minimise environmental impact.
  • Visitors to Melbourne can also enjoy immersive Aboriginal cultural experiences that not only provide insights into Indigenous traditions and heritage but also contribute to the economic development of local Indigenous communities. By engaging in these experiences as a visitor within the context of a broader event program, attendees can support and appreciate the rich cultural tapestry of Melbourne’s First Nations peoples.

 

In summary, Melbourne is a city that demonstrates a strong commitment to sustainability. With ambitious goals, accolades in sustainability rankings, and a wide range of eco-friendly options, it caters to environmentally conscious businesses and travelers seeking a responsible and enriching incentive travel experience.

acf.author: Cameron Williamson
acf.preview_text: Discover Sydney as a sustainable destination for eco-friendly meetings and events.

content.title: Introduction
content.content:
Meta: Discover Sydney as a sustainable destination for eco-friendly meetings and events.

Sydney is a city that takes sustainability seriously and is committed to reducing its environmental impact. As a popular destination for business events and incentive programs, it has a range of sustainable tourism options that cater to the needs of environmentally conscious businesses and travelers.

content.title: Fast facts
content.content:
Fast facts

  • According to a survey by the Global Destination Sustainability Index, Sydney is the highest-ranked city in the Asia-Pacific region for sustainability, and the 10th highest-ranked city globally. The City of Sydney’s Sustainable Destination Partnership Program and NSW state Government Net Zero Plan set out a goal to reach zero emissions by 2050. To achieve this the city has implemented a range of initiatives to support their carbon reduction goals, including a target of sourcing 100% renewable energy for the city by 2030.
  • Sustainable Meetings and Events: Sydney has a wide range of green venues for meetings, incentives, conferences and events. A central sustainable venue for large business events in the city is the Sydney International Convention Centre. The ICC is a 6* rated, Gold LEED certified exhibition and event venue that delivers a range of environmentally and socially sustainable solutions including solar energy, plant based menus and food donations through OzHarvest.
  • Sustainable Tourism: Sydney is deeply committed to sustainable tourism, and has defined sustainable tourism as a strategic priority within the corporate values of Business Events Sydney and Tourism Australia. There are a wealth of eco tour options on offer in Sydney and surrounds from interpretive bushwalks in the World Heritage Listed Blue Mountains region, to Wildlife encounters and luxury conservation tourism in the picturesque Wolgan Valley. Sydney also has a range of eco-friendly accommodations that have implemented sound sustainability initiatives including reduced energy consumption, waste minimisation and local conservation efforts.
  • Aboriginal cultural experiences in Sydney not only provide opportunities for visitors to learn about Indigenous culture and traditions, but also support the economic development of local Indigenous communities.

 

In short, the city is strongly committed to making Sydney a sustainable destination for meetings and events.
